intro: Euphrasia arguta, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairless stems and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a hairy texture. Euphrasia arguta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is known for its early spring blooming period.
